queries.description: Unused directives increase compilation time, increase code size and can introduce unnecessary dependencies.
queries.name: There shall be no unused include directives

A16-2-2.title: There shall be no unused include directives.

queries.description: Defining externally linked objects or functions in header files can result in violations of the One Definition Rule (i.e., linkage failure or undefined behaviour can result).
queries.name: It shall be possible to include any header file in multiple translation units without violating the One Definition Rule

A3-1-1.title: It shall be possible to include any header file in multiple translation units without violating the One Definition Rule.

queries.description: Using any header file extension other than: ".h", ".hpp" or ".hxx" makes code harder to understand.
queries.name: Header files, that are defined locally in the project, shall have a file name extension of one of: ".h", ".hpp" or ".hxx"

A3-1-2.title: Header files, that are defined locally in the project, shall have a file name extension of one of: ".h", ".hpp" or ".hxx".

queries.description: Using any implementation file extension other than ".cpp" makes project structure harder to understand.
queries.name: Implementation files, that are defined locally in the project, should have a file name extension of ".cpp"

A3-1-3.title: Implementation files, that are defined locally in the project, should have a file name extension of ".cpp".

queries.description: Using objects or functions with external linkage in implementation files makes code harder to understand.
queries.name: Objects or functions with external linkage (including members of named namespaces) shall be declared in a header file

A3-3-1.title: Objects or functions with external linkage (including members of named namespaces) shall be declared in a header file.

queries.description: Using anything other than a standard include guard form can make code confusing and can lead to multiple or conflicting definitions.
queries.name: Include guards shall be provided

implementation_scope.description: This query defines header file as any file that is included regardless of file extension. This query does not consider the use of `#pragma once` as a permitted header guard.
